Questions: Derive the formula for the equivalent resistance Req of resistors R1, R2, and R3 (a) in series and (b) in parallel, as shown in Fig. 28-1(a) and (b).
solution: In series: Vab = IR1 + IR2 + IR3; since current I is same, Req = R1 + R2 + R3. In parallel: I = V/R1 + V/R2 + V/R3 => 1/Req = 1/R1 + 1/R2 + 1/R3.

Questions: A battery (internal resistance 1 Ω) is connected in series with two resistors. Compute (a) the current in the circuit, (b) the p.d. across each resistor, and (c) the terminal p.d. of the battery.
solution: Req = 18 Ω; I = V/R = 1.0 A; V_12Ω = 12 V, V_5Ω = 5 V; terminal p.d. = 18 V - 1Ω·1A = 17 V.

Questions: A 120-V house circuit has bulbs rated at 40.0 W, 60.0 W, and 75.0 W. Find the equivalent resistance.
What resistance must be placed in parallel with 12 Ω to get a combined resistance of 4 Ω?
solution: Using 1/Req = 1/R1 + 1/R2, we solve for R2 = 6 Ω.

solution: All resistors have 40 V; I_2Ω = 20 A, I_5Ω = 8 A, I_8Ω = 5 A. I_total = 33 A.

solution: R_parallel = 5 Ω; Req = 6 Ω; I = 4 A; I_15Ω = 1.3 A; V_terminal = 21.2 V.

What resistance must be placed in parallel with 20 Ω to make the combined resistance 15 Ω?

By use of one or more of the three resistors 3.0 Ω, 5.0 Ω, and 6.0 Ω, a total of 18 resistances can be obtained. What are they?

Two resistors, of 4.0 Ω and 12.0 Ω, are connected in parallel across a 22-V battery having internal resistance 1.0 Ω. Compute (a) the battery current, (b) the current in the 4.0-Ω resistor, (c) the terminal voltage of the battery, (d) the current in the 12.0-Ω resistor.

Three resistors, of 40 Ω, 60 Ω, and 120 Ω, are connected in parallel, and this parallel group is connected in series with 15 Ω in series with 25 Ω. The whole system is then connected to a 120-V source. Determine (a) the current in the 25 Ω, (b) the potential drop across the parallel group, (c) the potential drop across the 25 Ω, (d) the current in the 60 Ω, (e) the current in the 40 Ω.
What shunt resistance should be connected in parallel with an ammeter having a resistance of 0.040 Ω so that 25 percent of the total current will pass through the ammeter?
A 36-Ω galvanometer is shunted by a resistor of 4.0 Ω. What part of the total current will pass through the instrument?

A relay of resistance 6.0 Ω operates with a minimum current of 0.030 A. It is required that the relay operate when the current in the line attains 0.240 A. What resistance should be used to shunt the relay?
Show that if two resistors are connected in parallel, the rates at which they produce thermal energy vary inversely as their resistances.
solution: Using power formula P = I²R, in parallel the voltage is same, so P = V²/R ⇒ power is inversely proportional to resistance.
